justification: FormatterDiagnostic is not a hub. It has 0 outgoing dependencies (no outgoing_dependencies provided) and only 4 incoming dependencies: com.google.googlejavaformat.java.FormatterException, com.google.googlejavaformat.Input, com.google.googlejavaformat.OpsBuilder, and com.google.googlejavaformat.FormattingError. Hub-like modularization requires an abstraction to have a large number of both incoming and outgoing dependencies; the absence of outgoing dependencies and the small incoming set mean the smell is not present.

AutoIndent has 0 outgoing dependencies and only 1 incoming dependency (from com.google.googlejavaformat.java.javadoc.JavadocWriter). Hub-like Modularization requires an abstraction to have many incoming and outgoing connections; AutoIndent does not exhibit a large number of both incoming and outgoing dependencies.

The class has a very small set of outgoing dependencies (only com.google.googlejavaformat.Input, with references to Input.Token and FormatterDiagnostic). It has incoming references from a single class (com.google.googlejavaformat.java.JavaInputAstVisitor). There are not many distinct incoming or outgoing abstraction dependencies in the provided data, so it does not meet the criteria for Hub-like Modularization.

The counts of incoming and outgoing connections are small, so the class does not exhibit hub-like modularization.
